reg.title: Hotel Room Tax Regulation for the Sun Peaks Mountain Resort Area
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 170/2012, June 25, 2012]

definition.def: means the Hotel Room Tax Act;
means the land comprising the Sun Peaks Mountain Resort Area, as set out in Minister's Order 135/1996.

section.sectiontext: October 31, 2005 is the prescribed date after which section 3 of the Act applies in respect of accommodation purchased in the Resort Area.
The tax payable under section 3 (1) of the Act is 2% of the purchase price of accommodation purchased in the Resort Area.

section.marginalnote: Prescribed purposes for expenditure of tax
section.sectiontext: The Sun Peaks Mountain Resort Association may spend the amount paid to it out of the revenue collected from the tax for

paragraph.paragraphtext: tourism marketing, programs and projects, and
funding for the capital cost of constructing a public road from the Resort Area to Highway 1 (Trans-Canada).

section.sectiontext: This regulation is repealed effective July 1, 2017.

footnote.footnotetext: See section 45 of the Provincial Sales Tax Transitional Provisions and Amendments Act, 2013, S.B.C. 2013, c. 1

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Hotel Room Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 207, section 43 (2) (e) and (f)]
